channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 16/08/25
item.content:encoded:
This time next week, we’ll be on the other side of Gamescom, and I’ll be churning through reams and reams of preview write ups. It’s going to be a heckin’ busy time as always, and I’ve got some nice and exciting games on my schedule to check out in Cologne!

In the News This Week

There’s bound to be a bunch of trailers and announcement during Opening Night Live on Tuesday, so this week has been a touch quieter…

  • All similarities between Light of Motiram and Horizon have been wiped from Steam
  • Football Manager 26 Match Day experience teased in new video
  • inZOI heads to PS5 in 2026, free Island Getaway DLC launches next week
  • Neo Berlin 2087 gets a new gameplay trailer
  • LEGO Voyagers gets a release date of September 15th
  • Crimson Desert has been delayed again, now due in 2026
  • Bithell Games lays off “majority of full time staff”

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s get stuck into the reviews, where we had some real highs and some real disappointments to come alongside.

  • Is This Seat Taken? – NSW, PC – 9/10
  • The Dark Queen of Mortholme – PC – 9/10
  • One-Eyed Likho – PC – 8/10
  • Abyssus – PC – 6/10
  • Drag x Drive – NSW2 – 5/10 (Video Review)
  • Space Drop – PSVR 2, Quest – 3/10

In a pseudo review, Tuffcub spoke to the TSA Destiny 2 clan to find a consensus on the latest expansion, The Edge of Fate, and where the game can go from here.

We also had a couple hardware reviews with the Final VR3000 Wireless earbuds making a compelling case for themselves, and there’s the Turtle Beach Rematch controller, which sure is a colourful Switch gamepad.

Beyond the reviews, Dom had a great time digging into the Grounded 2 Early Access, and Jason a sheepishly good time with Ovis Loop’s wolf battling, and I got to check out Jackbox Party Pack 11, which is absolutely going to bring the noise.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Grounded 2, Tiny Bookshop and Drag x Drive

Trailer Park

Ghost of Yotei’s latest footage shows Atsu wielding the yari

See a graphics comparison of Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac remake

Chibi-Robo! joins the Switch Online GameCube library this month

Your Achievements

What have you played this week?

  • Andrewww has continued on with Jedi: Survivor and continued to have a rather enjoyable time, especially with a lightened difficulty. In other media, he’s started watching the TV series Alien: Earth and found the first episode to be very promising.

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend and we’ll see you for more gaming gubbins on Monday.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/16/something-for-the-weekend-16-08-25/
